title: The Block 2019 inspections: Hundreds camp outside St Kilda townhouses overnight
text:
The Block's townhouses at the former Oslo hotel in St Kilda, Melbourne opened their doors to the public on Sunday morning for this year's open inspections.

And with space inside the multi-million dollar renovations limited, hundreds of fans decided to camp outside the properties overnight to be the first inside.

Footage shared by The Blockinator Blog at around 4am showed crowds of people already lining in metal barriers while wrapped in blankets.

For sale! The Block's townhouses at the Oslo hotel in Melbourne opened their doors to the public on Sunday with Scott Cam (centre) and Shelley Craft (right) opening the inspections

The video featured fans of all ages, with many flying into Melbourne for the event.

Filmed in the dead of the night, the crowd appeared relaxed, with many sitting in camping chairs and enjoying some sleep before the inspections began.

With so many fans descending onto the street, the road was blocked off with people quietly queuing in specially erected pens.

Dedicated! And with space inside the multi-million dollar renovations limited, hundreds of fans camped outside the properties overnight to be the first inside

Long night ahead! Footage shared by The Blockinator Blog at around 4am showed crowds of people already lining in metal barriers while wrapped in blankets

Wow! Thousands of fans had descended onto the street by 10am, with many waving posters supporting their favourite team on the show

Some followers of the show had even braved two nights on the street, after setting up camp outside the five properties on Friday.

By 10am on Sunday, the atmosphere was simply electric as host Scott Cam and challenge master Shelley Craft cut a ribbon and officially started the inspections.

Thousands of fans had descended onto the street by this stage, with many waving posters supporting their favourite team on the show.

Tourist attraction! Fans have been flocking to the townhouses for months now

Transformation: The current season of The Block was filmed at the Oslo Hotel in St Kilda

Before The Block took over the Oslo Hotel, the property was a rundown backpacker hostel.

The five apartments will go to auction later this month, with each of them expected to sell for at least $3 million.

However, with many of the teams overspending this year and blowing their budgets, it is doubtful all of the townhouses will be complete.
description: The Block's townhouses at the former Oslo hotel in St Kilda, Melbourne opened their doors to the public on Sunday morning for this year's open inspections.
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
